definition: color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]

sentences.english: He disguised these feelings under an enormous bellowing and hurraying.
sentences.chinese: 他用大聲吼叫和喝采掩飾着這些感情。

sentences.english: Enthusiastic cheers expressed their appreciation of the performance.
sentences.chinese: 熱烈的喝采表達了他們對演出的讚賞。

sentences.english: Each angel casts a special joy, that brings us all such cheer.
sentences.chinese: 每個天使發出別緻的歡樂，帶給所有人喝采。

sentences.english: And when, responding to the cheers, he lightly doffed his hat.
sentences.chinese: 他輕揚球帽，迴應澎派的喝采。

sentences.english: The excellent acrobatic performance brought down the house.
sentences.chinese: 精采的雜技表演博得全場喝采。

sentences.english: Your applause would react on the speaker.
sentences.chinese: 你們的喝采封演說者有影響。

sentences.english: Her performance was cheered to echo.
sentences.chinese: 她賭表演獲得長時間的喝采。

sentences.english: All the wrestlers and eunuchs present applauded enthusiastically.
sentences.chinese: 衆武士和太監齊聲喝采。

sentences.english: After the show, everyone stood up to cheer.
sentences.chinese: 表演結束後，每個人都站起來喝采。

sentences.english: The singer was called back three times.
sentences.chinese: 那個歌手被喝采聲叫到幕前謝幕三次。

sentences.english: Ah Mui " encored" responding to the shouting and clapping of the maddening audience.
sentences.chinese: 在觀衆狂熱的喝采聲中，阿梅“安哥”。

sentences.english: The cellist's solo was applauded with a standing ovation.
sentences.chinese: 那位大提琴家的獨奏獲到觀衆起立鼓掌喝采。

sentences.english: Jane brought down the house with a belly dance.
sentences.chinese: 珍以一曲肚皮舞搏得滿堂喝采。
有些人則對他的夢喝采。

sentences.english: The winning team were cheered by their supporters.
sentences.chinese: 獲勝的隊受到熱情觀衆的喝采。

sentences.english: They are cheering for their favorite players.
sentences.chinese: 他們在爲喜愛的球員們喝采。

definition: adverse audience reaction: boos and jeers, hissing, catcalls or deliberate applause after a mistake
to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
